text: Psalm 143
A Prayer for Rescue from Enemies
A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 143 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
O Yahweh, hear my prayer;
listen to my supplications.
In your faithfulness answer me,
\add and\add* in your righteousness.
And do not enter into judgment with your servant,
because no one alive \add is\add* righteous before you.
For \add the\add* enemy has pursued my soul;
he has crushed my life to the ground.
He has made me dwell in dark places
like \add those\add* long dead.
And \add so\add* my spirit grows faint within me;
my heart ⸤within⸥\f + \fr 143:4 \ft Literally “in the midst of” \f* me is desolate.
I remember \add the\add* days of long ago;
I meditate on all your doings.\f + \fr 143:5 \ft Hebrew “doing” \f*
I muse on the labor of your hands.
I stretch out my hands to you;
my soul \add longs\add* for you like a dry land. \qs Selah\qs*
Quickly answer me, O Yahweh;
my spirit fails.
Do not hide your face from me,
or I will become
like \add those\add* descending to \add the\add* pit.
Cause me to hear your loyal love in the morning,
for I trust you.
Cause me to know the way that I should go,
for I lift up my soul to you.
Deliver me from my enemies, O Yahweh.
I take refuge in you.\f + \fr 143:9 \ft This reading for the difficult Hebrew “I cover to you” is suggested by the LXX \f*
Teach me to do your will, for you \add are\add* my God;
your Spirit \add is\add* good.
Lead me onto level ground.
For your name’s sake, O Yahweh, preserve my life;
in your righteousness bring me\f + \fr 143:11 \ft Hebrew “my soul” \f* out of trouble.
And in your loyal love destroy my enemies,
and exterminate all \add the\add* adversaries of my soul,
for I \add am\add* your servant.
